metadata.title: CVE-2017-16651 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Roundcube Webmail before 1.1.10, 1.2.x before 1.2.7, and 1.3.x before 1.3.3allows unauthorized access to arbitrary files on the host's filesystem,including configuration files, as exploited in the wild in November 2017.The attacker must be able to authenticate at the target system with a validusername/password as the attack requires an active session. The issue isrelated to file-based attachment plugins and_task=settings&_action=upload-display&_from=timezone requests.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16651` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

roundcube - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-core - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-mysql - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-pgsql - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-plugins - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-sqlite3 - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: roundcube package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.6+dfsg.1-1').
